# init(lowerAngleLimit:upperAngleLimit:)

**Initializer**

Initializes a new reach constraint object.

## Declaration

```swift
init(lowerAngleLimit: CGFloat, upperAngleLimit: CGFloat)
```

## Parameters

- **lowerAngleLimit**: The minimum angle that the node can have when it is rotated by a reach event.
- **upperAngleLimit**: The maximum angle that the node can have when it is rotated by a reach event.

## Return Value

A newly initialized reach constraint.

## Discussion

When a reach action is executed, a node’s [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKNode/zRotation] property may be changed by the action to satisfy the reach action. Any value calculated by the reach action for a node is always inside the range specified by the reach constraint attached to the node’s [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKNode/reachConstraints] property.

## Working with Reach Constraints

- **lowerAngleLimit**: The minimum angle that the node can have after it is rotated by a reach event.
- **upperAngleLimit**: The maximum angle that the node can have after it is rotated by a reach event.
